net.pandoragames.util.i18n

Class LocalizerBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.util.i18n.LocalizerBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Localizer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BundleLocalizer, DefaultLocalizer

    public abstract class LocalizerBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Localizer
    Base class for simple Localizer implementations. Inheriting classes only have to implement the abstract method localize().

    If multiple threads are accessing this object, they should synchronize on it.

    Author:
    Olivier Wehner

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getLanguage()
      Returns the ISO language code of the java.util.Locale object currently used for rendering
      java.util.Locale getLocale()
      Returns the java.util.Locale object that is currently used for formatting
      java.lang.String localize(java.util.Date date, java.lang.String patternCode)
      Returns a String representing the specified Date object using the format pattern that is represented by the specified code.
      java.lang.String localize(double number, int digits)
      Renders the specified double value with exactly the number of specified digits and according to the rulse imposed by the currently used Locale object of this Localizer instance.
      java.lang.String localize(long number)
      Returns a String representing the specified long value and rendered for the currently used Locale of this Localizer instance.
      java.lang.String localize(java.lang.String code, java.lang.Object replacementValue)
      Returns some locale specific, human readable text for the specified code, filled with the specified replacement value using java.text.MessageFormat syntax.
      java.lang.String localize(java.lang.String code, java.lang.Object[] replacementValues)
      Returns some locale specific, human readable text for the specified code, filled with the specified replacement values using java.text.MessageFormat syntax.
      java.util.Date parseDate(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String patternCode)
      Returns the java.util.Date object that is represented by the specified String.
      java.lang.Double parseDouble(java.lang.String doubleNumber)
      Returns the double value that is represented by the specified String, or throws a ParseException if parsing fails.
      java.lang.Integer parseInt(java.lang.String integerNumber)
      Returns the int value that is represented by the specified String, or throws a ParseException if parsing fails.
      java.lang.Long parseLong(java.lang.String longNumber)
      Returns the long value that is represented by the specified String, or throws a ParseException if parsing fails.

      • localize

        public java.lang.String localize(java.lang.String code,
                        java.lang.Object replacementValue)
        Returns some locale specific, human readable text for the specified code, filled with the specified replacement value using java.text.MessageFormat syntax. This is a convinience shortcut for the multi object localize() method.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface Localizer
        Parameters:
        code - application internal code for some text
        replacementValue - object that shall be filled into the place holder of the resulting text.
        Returns:
        human readable text (or null)
        See Also:
        Localizer.localize(String, Object[])

      • localize

        public java.lang.String localize(java.lang.String code,
                        java.lang.Object[] replacementValues)
        Returns some locale specific, human readable text for the specified code, filled with the specified replacement values using java.text.MessageFormat syntax.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface Localizer
        Parameters:
        code - application internal code for some text
        replacementValues - objects that shall be filled into the place holder of the resulting text.
        Returns:
        human readable text (or null)
        See Also:
        MessageFormat

      • localize

        public java.lang.String localize(long number)
        Returns a String representing the specified long value and rendered for the currently used Locale of this Localizer instance.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface Localizer
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • localize

        public java.lang.String localize(double number,
                        int digits)
        Renders the specified double value with exactly the number of specified digits and according to the rulse imposed by the currently used Locale object of this Localizer instance.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface Localizer
        Parameters:
        number - value to be rendered.
        Returns:
        locale specific representation of the specified double value with the indicated number of digits

      • localize

        public java.lang.String localize(java.util.Date date,
                        java.lang.String patternCode)
        Returns a String representing the specified Date object using the format pattern that is represented by the specified code. The patterCode argument is not directly used as a date pattern, it rather represents a date patern in the Locale of this instance.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface Localizer
        Parameters:
        date - date to be rendered.
        patternCode - refering a special date pattern
        Returns:
        locale specific representation of the specified Date object

      • parseDate

        public java.util.Date parseDate(java.lang.String date,
                       java.lang.String patternCode)
        Returns the java.util.Date object that is represented by the specified String. The patterCode argument is not directly used as a date pattern, it rather represents a date patern in the Locale of this instance.
        Specified by:
        parseDate in interface Localizer
        Parameters:
        date - String that represents a date
        patternCode - refering a special date pattern
        Returns:
        java.util.Date object represented by the specified String, or null if the String could not be parsed
